I'm tired of having to log into the Trados Cloud dashboard multiple times a day
by 
Jérôme Pott
 on 28 Mar 2025 8:26 AM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Could you please extend the duration of the auth token or make use of a refresh token, like any other websites out there? It seems that you're using the third-party Auth0 for authentication, so it shouldn't be so hard to implement: 
https://auth0.com/docs/secure/tokens/refresh-tokens
Even when I leave the dashboard open, I need to enter my credentials again after about 1 hour! I check my browser settings and it accepts cookies, and I stayed logged in to other websites when closing the browser.
Thanks!
 
Matching language pairs between project/TM and TB
by 
Anita Byrnes
 on 27 Mar 2025 12:18 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
IN Trados Team (university use) my student's project language pair is English -> Chinese (Traditional) and this was used for the TM. However the TB language pair is English - Chinese, as this seemed to be the only selection. She can't see (lookup) the TB when editing in Online Editor. Does the language pair of the TB have to match exactly the project/TM pair? The same would apply to varieties of Spanish and Arabic for example.
Thank you
RWS Community AI on 27 Mar 2025 12:19 PM
"Probability score": 0.9
"Question improvement suggestion": The question is quite clear, but it would be helpful to know the version of Trados Team being used.
In the meantime, based on the information you have provided, here is a suggested answer to your question:
Hello,
Yes, the language pair of the Termbase (TB) needs to match exactly with the project/Translation Memory (TM) pair in Trados Team. This is because Trados Team uses the language pair to determine which TBs and TMs to use during translation. If the language pair of the TB doesn't match the project/TM pair, the TB won't be visible during translation.
For example, if your student's project language pair is English -> Chinese (Traditional), the TB should also be set to English -> Chinese (Traditional). If the TB is set to English -> Chinese, it won't be visible because "Chinese" and "Chinese (Traditional)" are considered different languages in Trados Team.
The same applies to varieties of Spanish and Arabic. Each variety is considered a different language, so the TB and project/TM pairs need to match exactly.
To resolve this issue, your student should create a new TB with the exact language pair as the project/TM. Once the new TB is created and populated with terms, it should be visible during translation in the Online Editor.
I hope this answer addressed your question. If not, please reject the answer, add the question improvement suggestion information, and click the RWS Community AI checkbox on the right to try again.
RWS Community AI
 
Batch edit/delete and merging entries in Trados Terminology
by 
Jo Chapman
 on 26 Mar 2025 1:14 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
I am managing an enterprise term base in Trados Terminology. All entries have specific attributes to denote domain and class as well as standard term metadata such as status, term type, etc. I would like to be able to batch edit, batch delete or merge entries in the term base but I cannot find a way to do this.
Use cases:
Merge: I want to merge 2 or more existing duplicate entries, not merge a new entry into an existing entry.
Batch edit: I want to batch edit to apply a filter and then change an attribute for all entries at the same time
Batch delete: I want to apply a filter and remove several entries that meet the filter criteria.
I have checked the technical documentation, knowledge base and community for an existing answer but only found information relating to MultiTerm.
Can anyone advise if there is a function that I'm missing?
Jo Chapman on 27 Mar 2025 8:58 AM
Thanks for the clarification, Daniel. I'll bear the roadmap in mind.
Daniel Brockmann on 27 Mar 2025 7:59 AM
Hi Jo,
Merging is on the more short-term (CY 2025) while batch-edit and batch-delete on the longer term roadmap. To trigger a kind of 'force merge' in the meantime as a potential workaround, you can start editing the existing entry that you want to merge, and enter the same source term as a synonym (or edit an existing term to make it the same term as in the entry you want to merge). This will trigger the merge duplicate flow where you can then decide which fields to merge. If multiple duplicates exist, you can decide which one to merge with. We will look at decoupling this 'forced' merge flow into a separate merge flow that would not require this kind of artificial merge. It works quite well though, this helped me merge a few entries in a fairly complex termbase the other day.
Also tagging 
Ana-Maria Totea
  and 
Adrian Manea
  as an FYI.
Thanks, Daniel
Jo Chapman on 26 Mar 2025 1:16 PM
The answer relates to a different product.
RWS Community AI on 26 Mar 2025 1:15 PM
"Probability score": 0.7
"Question improvement suggestion": Please provide the exact version of Trados Terminology you are using and any error messages you might have encountered while trying to perform these actions. Also, it would be helpful to know if there have been any recent changes to your system or software.
In the meantime, based on the information you have provided, here is a suggested answer to your question:
Hello,
From your description, it seems like you're trying to perform batch operations in Trados Terminology. While Trados Terminology does not directly support batch operations, you can use MultiTerm, which is part of the Trados Studio suite, to perform these tasks.
Here are the steps you can follow:
Step 1: Open MultiTerm and select the termbase you want to edit.
Step 2: For batch editing, you can use the 'Termbase > Edit > Edit Entry' option. You can apply a filter and then change an attribute for all entries at the same time.
Step 3: For batch deletion, you can use the 'Termbase > Delete Entry' option. Again, you can apply a filter and remove several entries that meet the filter criteria.
Step 4: For merging entries, you can use the 'Synchronize on Entry Number' option during import to merge terms correctly. 
Please note that these operations should be performed with caution as they can significantly alter your termbase. Always make sure to back up your termbase before making any changes.
I hope this answer addressed your question. If not, please reject the answer, add the question improvement suggestion information, and click the RWS Community AI checkbox on the right to try again.
RWS Community AI

Autosuggest without having to type first letter
by 
Leni VERBOGEN
 on 27 Mar 2025 12:17 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hi, I'd like to see Autosuggest suggest a word after a space, and thus not after typing a letter. In this way, one can work much faster and be sure to see the suggestions. Because now, if I type another letter than the one the word autosuggest wants to propose starts with, I won't see the suggestion in the drop-down menu in the segment itself.
An example: if I write 'Please give me a p', with the intention of writing 'proposal', Autosuggest won't prompt me with 'suggestion' instead.
However, if Autosuggest were active right after a space, I would see the word 'suggestion' suggested when I type
 'Please give me a '.

使用バージョン：Trados Studio 2024 (CU2：18.0.2.3255)
エディタでファイルを開いたとき、直前に閉じたファイルのフィルタ設定が有効のままになっている。
別プロジェクトのファイルでも同じ。

ファイルを開いたとき、フィルタがかかった状態で表示されるので困る。
----------------------
Filter settings persist between files in Trados Studio 2024 CU2
In Trados Studio 2024 (CU2: 18.0.2.3255), when opening a file in the Editor, the filter settings from the previously closed file remain active — even if the file belongs to a different project.
This is a change from previous behaviour (up to CU1), where filter settings were reset upon closing a file.
The result is that newly opened files can appear with filters already applied, which is confusing and inconvenient, especially when working across multiple projects.
Suggestion:
 Please revert to the previous behaviour where filter settings are cleared when a file is closed.
Daniel Brockmann on 26 Mar 2025 8:13 AM

 When I open a file, it is displayed with a filter applied, which is inconvenient.

 by 
Pascal Zotto
 on 19 Mar 2025 2:19 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hi, sometimes it would be nice if we could tell Trados not to add a space after certain segments when reverting to source file format. Quite often you get poorly prepared/segmented files from a client...
Seraina Hartmann on 24 Mar 2025 7:33 AM
 Hi 
Pascal Zotto
 
Is it not better to merge the segments in the editor in this case?
I imagine you wouldn't want units like "240-Volt" and "Leitung" to be stored in your TM seperately?
If you merge the segments in the editor, you'll have the units properly stored in your TM ("240-Volt-Leitung") as well as no problem with spaces at the end of the segments.
To merge the segments, select the segments e.g. with click+ctrl > right click > select "Merge Segments" -> the content of the selected segments is merged into one single segment.
Example:
-> Segment 2 is merged with segment 1:
I hope this helps.
Have a great week ahead.
Best regards
Seraina

This sounds like more of a bug to me, so I suggest we handle this via a support ticket rather than the Ideas area. Can you please raise a Support request to cover this issue?
Cheers,
Ian

 on 26 Mar 2025 5:25 PM in

Preview for Source Files
by 
Hannah Lambie
 on 26 Mar 2025 5:22 PM in 
Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
We have a client that uses an Excel template for all projects. The workflow is customised (multilingual file delivery), so it's important that all templates are correct.
With 200 + job requestor users, it's really hard to police that the source files are correct, and so the project managers need to download each and every file to check it's correct.
It would be super helpful if there was a preview function (like in the review pane) where the PJM could see at a glance whether the template is correct.
Josje ter Maat on 27 Mar 2025 9:35 AM
Very good idea that would bring efficiency and time savings for our PJM team. By standard our PJM's are checking the source if it's not XML/HTML to see what is inside.

Time stamps in the Files tab in a project in Projects view seem to refer to the task creation rather than the last file update (completion), and this can be misleading. Because the file is actually co...
CAMELIA GHEORGHIES on 25 Mar 2025 1:35 PM
We know that in the Task History view we can see an updated timestamp (task completion date), but we see no reason not to see this information in the Files tab. Or for users to have to change tabs to cross-check information.
Anyway, it turns out that other colleagues of mine raised the case with Support directly (case 00801572) and there is already a CRQ-34255.

subject: Be Part of Creole’s Digital Future  Maya!
body:
Celebrating 10 Years With Us!
Haitian Creole In Digital Age: From Spoken Word 
To Global Platforms.
 
Bonjou Maya!
 
What is possible?
 When it comes to Haitian Creole in the digital age, the answer is more exciting than ever.
 
For generations, Creole thrived in conversations, music, and storytelling. But now, it’s making waves in spaces once thought unreachable—on social media, in digital platforms, and across global networks. The demand for Creole is growing and  transforming the way people connect, communicate, and claim their linguistic identity.
 
In 2022, Creole Solutions played a pivotal role in this movement, helping one of the world’s biggest tech companies localize their platform entirely in Creole. The result? A moment of pure joy and validation for countless Creole speakers who finally saw their language fully represented in the digital world.
 
What is possible?
 
Haitian Creole In The Digital Age!
The rapid rise in demand for
 Haitian Creole
 was an indication of major shifts in language use. Soon after their arrival, Haitian immigrants in the U.S. no longer relied on the stilted French they had learned in school and instead turned to Creole as their main language of communication. 
 
With Creole already spoken and used in print, for example for tax forms, it was hardly a surprise that
 social media came next.
 
Thousands of people began to exchange messages in Creole on social platforms. In 2022, 
Creole Solutions
 was selected by one of the giants in the social media business to help translate the entire user interface of their platform.
 
Creole was entering the digital age, and 
Marleen and her team
 were right in the middle of the effort. Many people had the same response when they first saw the fully localized interface in their own language: Tears of joy.
 
 
LocWorld
 is the leading conference for global business, translation, and localization—bringing together experts shaping the future of language access. At LocWorld, Marleen Julien shared how
 Haitian Creole
 is making its mark in the digital world, including the launch of a social media platform fully accessible in Creole.
Celebrate with Us!
 
What’s Next?
Haitian Creole is making strides in digital spaces. From social media platforms to online learning and business tools, the language is reaching more people than ever before. Creole is no longer just spoken—it’s written, shared, and embedded in the digital world.
 
Each month, we will highlight a new way Haitian Creole is expanding. Let’s continue the conversation. Share your thoughts and experiences—because every step forward for Creole is a step toward greater access and visibility.
Learn more about us
 
Stay in the loop!
For more updates and exciting news, make sure to follow our page and stay connected with us on social media. 
 
 
 
 
Creole Solutions, 4957 Oakton Street, Suite 203, Skokie, IL 60076, United States

body:

.
 
As we kick off 2025, we are thrilled to celebrate

What’s Possible with Haitian Creole Series

subject: Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team and cloud capabilities in Trados Studio Weekly Digest - 9 Mar 2025
body:
Update from RWS Community
YOUR Weekly DIGEST FOR 9 Mar 2025
Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team and cloud capabilities in Trados Studio
Product Updates
New Posts
Trados 25.03.1 Release
 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
New Questions
Termbase on Trados live Team
Hi, We need to know how to activate the leverage analysis of internal fuzzy matches.
QA checker restrictions visible for customer reviewers
New Replies
Translation Engine Search Logic
 
 
Trados 25.03.1 Release
by 
Ian Parnell
 on 3 Mar 2025 4:36 PM in 
Product Updates
The latest Trados release is now available and we are excited to share the new functionality that has been delivered.
 
New features and updates are automatically added to your account so just log in to Trados and they will be available immediately.
 
Workflow views
(Applies to
 
Trados Team, Accelerate and Enterprise)
Prior to this release, it was possible to view workflows and interact with them in two different ways: either as a vertical list of tasks and phases (the Vertical view) or as a horizontal representation (the Phases view) that was introduced in late-2024. We announced at that time the Vertical view will be removed in an upcoming release.
Based on customer feedback, we are introducing a new List view. The List view works similarly to the Phases view but presents tasks and phases as a vertical list for users that prefer this layout design.
The legacy Vertical view will be removed before the end of March 2025. We therefore encourage users to familiarize themselves with the Phases or List views prior to the Vertical view before removed.
Batch replace files in Inbox
(Applies to
 
Trados Team, Accelerate and Enterprise)
When uploading files for accepted tasks from the Inbox, we have extended the automated file matching to check the Task ID from previous tasks.
As a practical example, a linguist downloads a file at the Translation task prior to completing the task. This linguist is then also assigned to the subsequent Linguistic Review task, and they upload the same file they downloaded at the earlier Translation task, as it may be more efficient to implement changes in the previous file.
If the linguist now uploads the previous file, it will now be automatically matched, despite the Task ID in the file coming from the earlier Translation task.
In this scenario, users will be presented with a warning message to explain how the match was identified and to only proceed if this is their intended action, to help prevent human error.
Analysis statistics in Inbox
(Applies to
 
Trados Team, Accelerate and Enterprise)
We now include a breakdown of the analysis statistics in the Inbox, so users with tasks assigned to them can easily access this information to help manage and prioritize their workload. Each category from the analysis statistics is displayed as a separate column from a user’s Inbox, with the exception of fuzzy matches which are aggregated into a single column. 
Note: the analysis statistics are only displayed for tasks that are based at target file level and for tasks created following this release. The columns will appear empty for tasks that were created prior to this release.
Ad-hoc cost type for Pricing Models
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
We have introduced a new Ad-hoc cost type for Pricing Models that can be used when you want to include a flat cost that isn’t dependent on any other variable in a project, such as the word or page count. Where configured, an Ad-hoc cost can be set implicitly in the original Pricing Model or added during the Customer Quote Review or Vendor Quote Review tasks.
Vendor Pricing Models
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
We have introduced greater flexibility in vendor pricing models to support costs based on a service type.
Prior to this release, it was already possible to create additional language costs in vendor pricing models based on a service type. With the release, you can also now create additional project costs based on a service type.
In addition, you can also define service type costs at language level by entering a cost for each of the bands contained in the pricing model.
Quote templates for Vendors
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
It is now possible to apply quote templates to vendor quotes. 
 
Quote templates allow you to adapt the format and layout of a quote, by including your own logo and controlling which information and content should be included. For more information on quote templates, please consult the original release 
announcement
 or product 
documentation
. In addition, sample quote templates can be found under the Files section in the Trados 
Community
.
 
To apply quote templates for vendors, you should first create the quote template in the usual manner from the Resources section under the Pricing menu. Once available, you can then associate a quote template with a vendor from the 
Vendor > Settings
 page, so this is applied to quotes from that vendor.
 
Custom Reporting updates
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
Image component in Custom Reporting
Report authors can now upload images directly from their local desktop to QuickSight for a variety of use cases, such as adding company logos and branding, including background images with free-form layout, and creating captivating story covers. This feature also supports tooltip and alt text, providing additional context and accessibility for consumers. Furthermore, it offers navigation and URL actions, enabling authors to make their images interactive, such as triggering specific dashboard actions when the image is clicked.
Font Customization for Visuals
The Custom Reporting module in Trados now supports the ability to customize fonts across specific visuals. Authors can completely customize fonts for Table and Pivot table visuals, while for remaining visuals, they can customize fonts for specific properties including the title, subtitle, legends title and legends values. 
Authors can set the font size (in pixels), font family, color, and styling options like bold, italics, and underline. With this update, you can align the dashboard's fonts with your organization's branding guidelines, creating a cohesive and visually appealing experience. Additionally, the font customization options can help improve the readability and meet accessibility standards, especially when viewing visuals on a large screen.
Custom Reporting Workshop
Later this year, we will be hosting a Custom Reporting workshop as part of our ELEVATE conference, the localization industry's largest online event. This will be of particular interest to report authors working in Trados and help customers unlock the full potential of our custom reporting module. ELEVATE is taking place between the 6-8th May 2025, and you can secure your place at the event by registering 
here
.
API updates
Although there are no 
changes to the 
API this time, we would like to 
inform 
users that 
the 
API Keys
 mechanism is being deprecated
. It will no longer be possible to create new 
API Keys
 and users should employ the 
Application
 
methodology
 going forward.
 To keep 
up to date
 with 
API changes, 
we recommend checking with the 
What’s New
 page 
regularly to get 
more details.
Public API: UI Extensibility beta
As announced previously, we have introduced support for User Interface (UI) Extensions which offer the possibility to add custom user interface elements and functionality. Custom buttons and panels can be added to specific places within the user interface.
 
UI Extensibility is initially being offered in BETA. Customers interested in evaluating this functionality should keep in mind that significant changes are planned prior to the full release. For more details, please refer to the 
documentation
 page.
 
Additional changes
When choosing to include termbases when downloading a package, we now only include termbases that contain language pairs corresponding to the selected tasks
 
Users can download a report including a full audit trail of changes made to the project due date.
 
Users can change task due dates during project creation in Trados. This feature is supported when using the Phases or List workflow views and is only available to users with the 
Projects > Planning
 permission.
 
The Service Status page is now directly accessible from the Help & Documentation menu in the Trados user interface.
 
Various bug fixes and UX enhancements
 
Finally, I would like to draw your attention to a recent webinar summarizing the new features delivered in Trados during 2024. If you missed the live webinar or would like to watch a recap of the features that were delivered over the last 12 months, you can access the recording 
here
. 
By registering for access to this recording, you will also receive invitations to future Trados webinars. 
 
Trados Product Management
 
 
Termbase on Trados live Team
by 
Marianna Leporini
 on 6 Mar 2025 8:55 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
I can't see the Termbase on Trados live team
I was assigned a project using Trados live team. When I open Trados live team I get this notification: There are resources you don’t have access to and you can’t edit this translation engine. As a consequence, I can’t see the project’s Termbase neither on Trados live team nor on Trados Studio 2024. A collegue is working on the same project, the PM followed the same steps when assigned us our respective files, but they can see translation engine resources. How can I solve this problem?
Paul on 8 Mar 2025 7:43 AM
Marianna Leporini
 
I suggest you speak to the admin for your Trados Team instance and make sure that you have been given the appropriate permissions to access it.  Trados Team is a permissions based solution... you can read about how this works here and it might help you understand where the problem may be:
https://docs.rws.com/en-US/trados-team-791595/user-roles-and-their-permissions-729430
 
Hi, We need to know how to activate the leverage analysis of internal fuzzy matches.
by 
Muzammil Irshad
 on 5 Mar 2025 9:45 AM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
In Trados Studio, we’re able to make this additional analysis through the batch activities, but we want to reach the same report we get in Studio on Trados Team (attaching an example from Studio):
Can you please advise on how to activate this analysis report?
Thank you in advance
Paul on 5 Mar 2025 10:40 AM
Muzammil Irshad
 
You don't have to activate anything.  You just create a project in Trados Team that has a TM available, and then the report is automatically there in your Dashboard for the project:
Also under Reports:
If you mean you want to be able to see the exact same report in Trados Team when you push the project to Trados Team from Studio then is also occurs the same way.  I pushed a Trados Studio project to the cloud, that looked like this:
And when it got there it looks like this:
There is a slight discrepancy in the total segments (I have no idea why - 
Phillip Maieski
 ) but the analysis report was pushed with the project.
 
QA checker restrictions visible for customer reviewers
by 
Lucile Barbieri
 on 4 Mar 2025 10:40 AM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Hello, in the QA checker settings, when applying % restrictions in the number of characters of the target file, the translator is being informed about this limitation. However, the customer reviewer is not. I need to set up an error message for the customer reviewer so he is able to see this limitation when reviewing the files. Otherwise it does not make sense. Thanks.
 
New replies to
Translation Engine Search Logic
 by 
Caroline Hétu
 on 20 Feb 2025 4:49 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Hello! I have a question regarding translation engine search logic. If we have a translation engine containing several translation memories. how does Trados process when bringing back translation segm...
Caroline Hétu on 5 Mar 2025 1:20 PM
It's indeed bad news. It would be really great it priority could be given to the TMs order. 
Neeltje Stuurman on 3 Mar 2025 10:57 AM
OK< thanks for confirming. 
It's bad news but still good to know
Patrik Mazanek on 3 Mar 2025 10:51 AM
I reviewed this once more and I was not correct, currently for matches with the same match value ordering is as follow:
- change date
- use count
- TM order
This should be consistent behavior between Studio and Trados Cloud.
Neeltje Stuurman on 3 Mar 2025 9:45 AM
Patrik Mazanek
 
Ah, so that would mean that in the example above the "Grondstoffen" translation would be returned, even thoigh it is 'older', as the TM is higher up in the order?
That would be a massive relief!
Patrik Mazanek on 3 Mar 2025 9:40 AM
First we look across all TMs, on all hits, a TM specific penalty is applied. Then the results are returned based on the match value. For results with the same value, we sort them by the TM order, then by the dates.
Neeltje Stuurman on 3 Mar 2025 9:26 AM
Hi Christian, 
Does it always work like this in TE? Surely this makes no sense whatsoever, at least not for cases where matches from different TMs have the same percentage.
The whole reason people save content in different TMs and out them in a sequence is because they want to be able to ensure that the translation from TM AA is prioritized over the translation in TM BB when matches from the 2 TMs have the same match percentage. Applying the translation with the highest match percentage out of all the available TMs is fine, but when there are 2 matches with the same percentage from different TMs the translations from the first TM in the sequence, i.e. in TM AA, would need to be prioritized, even if it has an older creation/modification date.
For example one of our cllients has split their content into multiple "modules". There is often a lot of overlap in the source content for these modules, but the translations for the same sopurce will have to be different in different modules. So the client decided to have separate TMs for each module, and then to apply the TM for that specific module first in the sequence without a penalty while the TMs for the other modules get applied later on in the sequence.
The expectation is that this will ensure that if there is a translation in the first, module specific TM in the sequence, this will get reused as is while any translation from the TMs for the other modules will only get applied if there is no module-specific translation in the main TM.
For example, 
let’s say we have a TU with the source text “Resources” in both the 'Maintenance' module TM and the ;Finance' module TM.
In the Maintenance TM the translation is “Grondstoffen”, and this translation has been created/modified on the 1
st
 of Jan 2025.
And in Finance the translation is “Middelen”, and this translation has been created/modified on the 2
nd
 oyf Jan 2025 .
The expectations is that when we are applying the TMs to the Maintenance module, the translation from the Maintenance TM, namely “Grondstoffen”, would be applied, eventhoigh this has an older creation/modification date, as this is the translation specific to this module.
But what you are saying is that due to the way TMs in TE work, that’s not what will happen as TE would apply the most recent translation, which is “Middelen” from the Finance TM. Which would be wrong for the client.
So the TM apply logic should be:
1. Apply highest match percentage
2. If there are multiple matches from diffferent TMs, apply the match from the TM that is highest up in the sequences
Created/modified date should have no relevance whatsoever
Is there any chance this can be amended?
 
You received this email because you are subscribed to a Weekly Digest for this group. To manage your email subscriptions, 
go here
.
[ref:]

Default behaviour in translation status - can it be changed?
by 
Özge Ünlü
 on 7 Mar 2025 1:24 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hello,
When finishing translation in Trados Studio, the default behavior is that the project status changes to "In review", the progress bar of the translation is reset to 0. We would like to know if we can change this default behaviour and avoid that Studio automatically switches the projects to "In review" status.
Thanks in advance.
KR
Özge
Jerzy Czopik on 7 Mar 2025 1:36 PM
Of course you need to do a QA on your own translation. But again: it is YOU who changes the status of the segment. A modified segment has the status draft (or translation rejected or sign-off rejected) and that is a sign, something was wrong with it. This is work in progress. Before delivery you will usually accept all segments in either translation, review or sign-off process. Then your file will also have the right status. But during work in progress the status must be kept as it is.
Please don't take me wrong, but this is what makes TS so unique. You can follow all steps done and if you are being audited, this is also a way to show the auditor, if the file has really been revised.
Philippe Riondel on 7 Mar 2025 1:30 PM
I support that suggestion. This is annoying, since after completing a translation, we usually have to self revise it or to do some QA, and the project is not yet "In review", from the translator's stand point.
Jerzy Czopik on 7 Mar 2025 1:29 PM
This is not Trados Studio, it is the user. If you change the status of just one segment to translation rejected or translation approved, Trados will treat the file then as being revised. This is a feature and should NOT be changed at all. You have trhee processes in TS: translation, revision and sign-off. Properly used these are great for keeping track of what has happened with file(s) in project. In your case simply make sure all segments have the same status, i.e. translated, translation approved or signed off. But there are a lot of situations, where you need to keep some segments in not translated status—and in such cases the status of the file will of course show this.

Trados 25.03.1 Release
by 
Ian Parnell
 on 3 Mar 2025 4:36 PM in 
Product Updates
The latest Trados release is now available and we are excited to share the new functionality that has been delivered.
 
New features and updates are automatically added to your account so just log in to Trados and they will be available immediately.
 
Workflow views
(Applies to
 
Trados Team, Accelerate and Enterprise)
Prior to this release, it was possible to view workflows and interact with them in two different ways: either as a vertical list of tasks and phases (the Vertical view) or as a horizontal representation (the Phases view) that was introduced in late-2024. We announced at that time the Vertical view will be removed in an upcoming release.
Based on customer feedback, we are introducing a new List view. The List view works similarly to the Phases view but presents tasks and phases as a vertical list for users that prefer this layout design.
The legacy Vertical view will be removed before the end of March 2025. We therefore encourage users to familiarize themselves with the Phases or List views prior to the Vertical view before removed.
Batch replace files in Inbox
(Applies to
 
Trados Team, Accelerate and Enterprise)
When uploading files for accepted tasks from the Inbox, we have extended the automated file matching to check the Task ID from previous tasks.
As a practical example, a linguist downloads a file at the Translation task prior to completing the task. This linguist is then also assigned to the subsequent Linguistic Review task, and they upload the same file they downloaded at the earlier Translation task, as it may be more efficient to implement changes in the previous file.
If the linguist now uploads the previous file, it will now be automatically matched, despite the Task ID in the file coming from the earlier Translation task.
In this scenario, users will be presented with a warning message to explain how the match was identified and to only proceed if this is their intended action, to help prevent human error.
Analysis statistics in Inbox
(Applies to
 
Trados Team, Accelerate and Enterprise)
We now include a breakdown of the analysis statistics in the Inbox, so users with tasks assigned to them can easily access this information to help manage and prioritize their workload. Each category from the analysis statistics is displayed as a separate column from a user’s Inbox, with the exception of fuzzy matches which are aggregated into a single column. 
Note: the analysis statistics are only displayed for tasks that are based at target file level and for tasks created following this release. The columns will appear empty for tasks that were created prior to this release.
Ad-hoc cost type for Pricing Models
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
We have introduced a new Ad-hoc cost type for Pricing Models that can be used when you want to include a flat cost that isn’t dependent on any other variable in a project, such as the word or page count. Where configured, an Ad-hoc cost can be set implicitly in the original Pricing Model or added during the Customer Quote Review or Vendor Quote Review tasks.
Vendor Pricing Models
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
We have introduced greater flexibility in vendor pricing models to support costs based on a service type.
Prior to this release, it was already possible to create additional language costs in vendor pricing models based on a service type. With the release, you can also now create additional project costs based on a service type.
In addition, you can also define service type costs at language level by entering a cost for each of the bands contained in the pricing model.
Quote templates for Vendors
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
It is now possible to apply quote templates to vendor quotes. 
 
Quote templates allow you to adapt the format and layout of a quote, by including your own logo and controlling which information and content should be included. For more information on quote templates, please consult the original release 
announcement
 or product 
documentation
. In addition, sample quote templates can be found under the Files section in the Trados 
Community
.
 
To apply quote templates for vendors, you should first create the quote template in the usual manner from the Resources section under the Pricing menu. Once available, you can then associate a quote template with a vendor from the 
Vendor > Settings
 page, so this is applied to quotes from that vendor.
 
Custom Reporting updates
(Applies to
 
Trados Accelerate and Enterprise)
Image component in Custom Reporting
Report authors can now upload images directly from their local desktop to QuickSight for a variety of use cases, such as adding company logos and branding, including background images with free-form layout, and creating captivating story covers. This feature also supports tooltip and alt text, providing additional context and accessibility for consumers. Furthermore, it offers navigation and URL actions, enabling authors to make their images interactive, such as triggering specific dashboard actions when the image is clicked.
Font Customization for Visuals
The Custom Reporting module in Trados now supports the ability to customize fonts across specific visuals. Authors can completely customize fonts for Table and Pivot table visuals, while for remaining visuals, they can customize fonts for specific properties including the title, subtitle, legends title and legends values. 
Authors can set the font size (in pixels), font family, color, and styling options like bold, italics, and underline. With this update, you can align the dashboard's fonts with your organization's branding guidelines, creating a cohesive and visually appealing experience. Additionally, the font customization options can help improve the readability and meet accessibility standards, especially when viewing visuals on a large screen.
Custom Reporting Workshop
Later this year, we will be hosting a Custom Reporting workshop as part of our ELEVATE conference, the localization industry's largest online event. This will be of particular interest to report authors working in Trados and help customers unlock the full potential of our custom reporting module. ELEVATE is taking place between the 6-8th May 2025, and you can secure your place at the event by registering 
here
.
API updates
Although there are no 
changes to the 
API this time, we would like to 
inform 
users that 
the 
API Keys
 mechanism is being deprecated
. It will no longer be possible to create new 
API Keys
 and users should employ the 
Application
 
methodology
 going forward.
 To keep 
up to date
 with 
API changes, 
we recommend checking with the 
What’s New
 page 
regularly to get 
more details.
Public API: UI Extensibility beta
As announced previously, we have introduced support for User Interface (UI) Extensions which offer the possibility to add custom user interface elements and functionality. Custom buttons and panels can be added to specific places within the user interface.
 
UI Extensibility is initially being offered in BETA. Customers interested in evaluating this functionality should keep in mind that significant changes are planned prior to the full release. For more details, please refer to the 
documentation
 page.
 
Additional changes
When choosing to include termbases when downloading a package, we now only include termbases that contain language pairs corresponding to the selected tasks
 
Users can download a report including a full audit trail of changes made to the project due date.
 
Users can change task due dates during project creation in Trados. This feature is supported when using the Phases or List workflow views and is only available to users with the 
Projects > Planning
 permission.
 
The Service Status page is now directly accessible from the Help & Documentation menu in the Trados user interface.
 
Various bug fixes and UX enhancements
 
Finally, I would like to draw your attention to a recent webinar summarizing the new features delivered in Trados during 2024. If you missed the live webinar or would like to watch a recap of the features that were delivered over the last 12 months, you can access the recording 
here
. 
By registering for access to this recording, you will also receive invitations to future Trados webinars. 
 
Trados Product Management

Translation Engine Search Logic
 by 
Caroline Hétu
 on 20 Feb 2025 4:49 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Hello! I have a question regarding translation engine search logic. If we have a translation engine containing several translation memories. how does Trados process when bringing back translation segm...
Caroline Hétu on 5 Mar 2025 1:20 PM
It's indeed bad news. It would be really great it priority could be given to the TMs order. 
Neeltje Stuurman on 3 Mar 2025 10:57 AM
OK< thanks for confirming. 
It's bad news but still good to know
Patrik Mazanek on 3 Mar 2025 10:51 AM
I reviewed this once more and I was not correct, currently for matches with the same match value ordering is as follow:
- change date
- use count
- TM order
This should be consistent behavior between Studio and Trados Cloud.
Neeltje Stuurman on 3 Mar 2025 9:45 AM
Patrik Mazanek
 
Ah, so that would mean that in the example above the "Grondstoffen" translation would be returned, even thoigh it is 'older', as the TM is higher up in the order?
That would be a massive relief!
Patrik Mazanek on 3 Mar 2025 9:40 AM
First we look across all TMs, on all hits, a TM specific penalty is applied. Then the results are returned based on the match value. For results with the same value, we sort them by the TM order, then by the dates.
Neeltje Stuurman on 3 Mar 2025 9:26 AM
Hi Christian, 
Does it always work like this in TE? Surely this makes no sense whatsoever, at least not for cases where matches from different TMs have the same percentage.
The whole reason people save content in different TMs and out them in a sequence is because they want to be able to ensure that the translation from TM AA is prioritized over the translation in TM BB when matches from the 2 TMs have the same match percentage. Applying the translation with the highest match percentage out of all the available TMs is fine, but when there are 2 matches with the same percentage from different TMs the translations from the first TM in the sequence, i.e. in TM AA, would need to be prioritized, even if it has an older creation/modification date.
For example one of our cllients has split their content into multiple "modules". There is often a lot of overlap in the source content for these modules, but the translations for the same sopurce will have to be different in different modules. So the client decided to have separate TMs for each module, and then to apply the TM for that specific module first in the sequence without a penalty while the TMs for the other modules get applied later on in the sequence.
The expectation is that this will ensure that if there is a translation in the first, module specific TM in the sequence, this will get reused as is while any translation from the TMs for the other modules will only get applied if there is no module-specific translation in the main TM.
For example, 
let’s say we have a TU with the source text “Resources” in both the 'Maintenance' module TM and the ;Finance' module TM.
In the Maintenance TM the translation is “Grondstoffen”, and this translation has been created/modified on the 1
st
 of Jan 2025.
And in Finance the translation is “Middelen”, and this translation has been created/modified on the 2
nd
 oyf Jan 2025 .
The expectations is that when we are applying the TMs to the Maintenance module, the translation from the Maintenance TM, namely “Grondstoffen”, would be applied, eventhoigh this has an older creation/modification date, as this is the translation specific to this module.
But what you are saying is that due to the way TMs in TE work, that’s not what will happen as TE would apply the most recent translation, which is “Middelen” from the Finance TM. Which would be wrong for the client.
So the TM apply logic should be:
1. Apply highest match percentage
2. If there are multiple matches from diffferent TMs, apply the match from the TM that is highest up in the sequences
Created/modified date should have no relevance whatsoever
Is there any chance this can be amended?

Default behaviour in translation status - can it be changed?
by 
Özge Ünlü
 on 7 Mar 2025 1:24 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hello,
When finishing translation in Trados Studio, the default behavior is that the project status changes to "In review", the progress bar of the translation is reset to 0. We would like to know if we can change this default behaviour and avoid that Studio automatically switches the projects to "In review" status.
Thanks in advance.
KR
Özge
Jerzy Czopik on 7 Mar 2025 1:36 PM
Of course you need to do a QA on your own translation. But again: it is YOU who changes the status of the segment. A modified segment has the status draft (or translation rejected or sign-off rejected) and that is a sign, something was wrong with it. This is work in progress. Before delivery you will usually accept all segments in either translation, review or sign-off process. Then your file will also have the right status. But during work in progress the status must be kept as it is.
Please don't take me wrong, but this is what makes TS so unique. You can follow all steps done and if you are being audited, this is also a way to show the auditor, if the file has really been revised.
Philippe Riondel on 7 Mar 2025 1:30 PM
I support that suggestion. This is annoying, since after completing a translation, we usually have to self revise it or to do some QA, and the project is not yet "In review", from the translator's stand point.
Jerzy Czopik on 7 Mar 2025 1:29 PM
This is not Trados Studio, it is the user. If you change the status of just one segment to translation rejected or translation approved, Trados will treat the file then as being revised. This is a feature and should NOT be changed at all. You have trhee processes in TS: translation, revision and sign-off. Properly used these are great for keeping track of what has happened with file(s) in project. In your case simply make sure all segments have the same status, i.e. translated, translation approved or signed off. But there are a lot of situations, where you need to keep some segments in not translated status—and in such cases the status of the file will of course show this.

New replies to
Working with WorldServer packages in Trados Team
 by 
Jean-François Pelletier
 on 21 Feb 2025 12:57 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Hello all, I would like to know if there are general guidelines or tips about working with WS packages in Team, or experience to share. I can extract the .sdlxliff documents from the .wsxz packages, j...
Sébastien Desautel on 25 Feb 2025 10:30 PM
Hello Jean-François,
yes, this is correct. and yes: 1. import the sdlxliff in a new project, 2. import the TMX in TMs (that are already set up in the translation engine to make this easy) and 3. start the project/workflow to get the analysis from TE.
The analysis algorithms are not exactly the same in TE and WS so you must expect some differences between the respective reports when only the TMX are leveraged.
Kind regards
Sébastien
Jean-François Pelletier on 24 Feb 2025 7:17 PM
Thanks again, Sébastien!
It's all clear and it makes sense. Can I ask for one more clarification if you don't mind? From what I understand, the .SDLXLIF files won't contain any fuzzy matches. So it means that if we reanalyze the files with the TMX included, we could (and should) leverage more fuzzy matches for the translators, correct? So the process would be to import the .SDLXIFF and the TMX, reanalyze the files and generate new reports?
Kind regards,
JF
Sébastien Desautel on 24 Feb 2025 6:27 PM
Hello Jean-François,
TT will recognize the 100% matches (or better) as translated. For the untranslated segments, you can do whatever you want, like for a standard file: use your own settings (TM and/or MT) to pretranslate them, and yes this can be done with other fuzzy match categories. 
One thing you won't be able to change is the segmentation.
If you would like to leverage the segments exported as tmx, you will have to import them in the TM used for the analysis.
Use "Always overwrite existing translation" or "Overwrite existing translation if better match found." if the sdlxliff files are pretranslated with fuzzy matches and you want to prioritize your assets over WS pretranslation. 
WS pretranslation below 100% won't be taken into account in the analysis at all. The segments will be simply pretranslated and without any match in your TT TM, these segments will be counted as "new match" in the analysis.
Kind regards
Sébastien
Jean-François Pelletier on 24 Feb 2025 4:49 PM
Thanks, 
Daniel Brockmann
 !
I'm working with the API and SnapLogic to automate the tasks as much as possible, so no manual steps such as opening the packages in Studio. I know that the API has limitations, so my questions are really more about finding those limitations before they block me.
Kind regards,
JF
Jean-François Pelletier on 24 Feb 2025 4:45 PM
Hello 
Sebastien Desautel
 ,
Thanks a lot for your input! I also found out that the files seem to be processed very straight forward, and that the delivery packages are nothing else than the zipped .sdlxliff files.
I have another question if you don't mind (and if 
Daniel Brockmann
  doesn't delete your reply... 
😉
 ) : The source files are already pre-translated and populated, however the source file packages also contain .tmx files and some reporting data. How flexible is TT in case we need to re-apply MT, TM, and re-analyze using a different fuzzy matches breakdown category?
Kind regards,
JF
Daniel Brockmann on 24 Feb 2025 10:08 AM
Sorry 
Sebastien Desautel
  - I inadvertently deleted your answer, apologies! Here it is again:
"Hello Jean-François,
I worked on a similar project: the flow of the sdlxliff files in Trados Team is comparable to any other files. You can upload them in a new project and let them go through a standard workflow. TT detects the language direction of each file and will only prepare the file for the dedicated direction. You just have to take care that all language directions are available in the project template you are using, otherwise some sdlxliff files will be set as reference.
For the delivery, the translated files can be zipped and uploaded to WorldServer (I believe .zip extension is fine). That's at least what worked on the WS server we worked on. WS can find the internal path to upload the files through their metadata. So you don't have to create a specific return package. 
As far as I can remember, you can also zip files from different projects together and upload them at once.
Kind regards
Sébastien"
Sébastien Desautel on 24 Feb 2025 10:04 AM
Hello Jean-François,
I worked on a similar project: the flow of the sdlxliff files in Trados Team is comparable to any other files. You can upload them in a new project and let them go through a standard workflow. TT detects the language direction of each file and will only prepare the file for the dedicated direction. You just have to take care that all language directions are available in the project template you are using, otherwise some sdlxliff files will be set as reference.
For the delivery, the translated files can be zipped and uploaded to WorldServer (I believe .zip extension is fine). That's at least what worked on the WS server we worked on. WS can find the internal path to upload the files through their metadata. So you don't have to create a specific return package. 
As far as I can remember, you can also zip files from different projects together and upload them at once.
Kind regards
Sébastien
Daniel Brockmann on 24 Feb 2025 9:57 AM
Hi JF - you might be able to use the save to cloud flow here, that is. open the WorldServer package in Studio and save it to cloud there (right click on project name and use Save to Cloud). You can also continue the SDLXLIFF extraction route, in that case you would need to manually replace the translated SDLXLIFF files in your local project target language folders after delivery. Thanks, Daniel
 
New replies to
Translation Engine Search Logic
 by 
Caroline Hétu
 on 20 Feb 2025 4:49 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Hello! I have a question regarding translation engine search logic. If we have a translation engine containing several translation memories. how does Trados process when bringing back translation segm...
Caroline Hétu on 25 Feb 2025 1:23 PM
Thanks for your answer!
If we work entirely locally in Trados Studio using the same TMs, will the same logic apply?
Cristian Cozma on 25 Feb 2025 10:19 AM
Hi Caroline,
The results will be prioritized based on the higher percentage match principle. You may have a 95% match in your Memory AA but if you have a higher match in Memory BB or Memory CC, that will be suggested. If you have 2 matches with the same percentage in different TMs, the most recent one (Created on or Modified on) will be suggested.
I hope this helps! If you need more details however or you have any concerns this not working as expected in your case, please raise a support ticket from your RWS accounts and our technical suport team will gladly investigate this: 
https://gateway.sdl.com/apex/communityknowledge?articleName=000001889
Best regards,

Include timestamp and username in the list of uploaded files in Engineering tasks
by 
CAMELIA GHEORGHIES
 on 27 Feb 2025 4:40 PM in 
Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
Our pre-processing and post-processing engineers have complained that the list of files successively uploaded to replace source files or target files does not contain sufficient information to help them distinguish information. They can only see information such as V1, V2 etc., but they find that other details such as timestamp or username of the person uploading would be very useful in this respect.
 
Make the customization of the list/table view we see in a project in Projects view stick across the ...
by 
CAMELIA GHEORGHIES
 on 27 Feb 2025 3:36 PM in 
Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
Currently, when we customize the view in tabs such as Files and Task History in a project in Projects view (tabs where we see a list/table), we can customize the list so as not to see certain columns or we can move columns around. However, this customization does not stick: once we go out of that project and come back to it, the customization is gone. In addition, this customization has to be carried out each time for each project, whereas users might have always the same needs regardless of the project. So it would be useful is Trados Enterprise UI could remember the customization per user (so across the board, for all projects).

CAMELIA GHEORGHIES

Would it be possible to activate the sort by "project due date" in the Inbox? It works in the projects view, but not from the Inbox, where it is greyed out. Our project managers can see in their Inbox the project due date for the Planning type of tasks and they need to be able to sort by project due date, to prioritise projects with a tight deadline.

Peter Johnston

Access for Selective Termbase Editing
by 
Terence Tsang
 on 25 Feb 2025 11:12 PM in 
Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
Currently, granting a user editing permissions allows them to edit all termbases within a location.
We need the ability to grant editing access to specific termbases rather than all, allowing terminologists and subject matter experts to update only the relevant ones. There is strong internal demand for more granular access control to enable efficient termbase maintenance while preventing unintended modifications to restricted termbases.
 
Improve overall Vendor profiling
by 
Thomas Alwood
 on 25 Feb 2025 3:47 PM in 
Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
The information you can record in Enterprise regarding vendors is currently limited basically to name, email and pricing. In the past 20 years there has been a revolution in the translation industry in regards to vendor management include information such as quality metrics, registration steps, availability and other metadata which help Project Managers assign the best vendor to a task. Currently we have to manage this information outside of Enterprise which is very inconvenient. These are now pretty standard features in most Translation Business Management Systems.
 
Show Profile languages in Groups
by 
Bernhard Hoell
 on 24 Feb 2025 12:36 PM in 
Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
Currently the assigned languages for service types are only visible if you edit the user account - this is a problem:
Due to SSO integration, all our users are created at ROOT level and then added to different groups, after they have been given respective service types and language pair configurations to allow assigning the group and use the flexible workflow assignment.
I have full access to the users profiles, translation lead project managers on subsequent customer folders however may not even see which languages the users are able to handle.
It would be really useful to allow the Groups view that shows all users in a certain group to contain not only the name and email, but to contain the assigned languages and service types for those users likewise.
This would make it easier for the Lead PJMs to check if they have users for all relevant languages before they use the group based workflow assignment that takes into account the service type and language configuration.

Trados Enterprise & Accelerate Ideas
Currently, if you create a new project and add an MT provider to your Translation Engine, the MT will be automatically pre-filled into the segments. This is useful for some cases, however, in other ca...
Terence Tsang on 27 Feb 2025 7:40 PM
Hi Vera and other users who may be following this: I was informed that a feature was developed to control this behaviour in the online editor. You can find it View > Options (Settings).
This was a great first step, but I still suggested some changes to this feature. As the feature is currently enabled by default, this would mean that we as the owners of the MT engine would still need to request every single user of the Online Editor to disable this automatic application of MT. While disabling the setting might be a one-time requirement, the problem remains that we cannot guarantee that the linguist does not re-enable it on their own and our team would have no way to restrict that.
I suggested that they make this feature toggle to be part of the project settings. That way, project creators or managers can decide to enable or disable such a feature right from the very start, rather than letting it propagate to users of all target languages. This level of control would be much more helpful.
I can update this thread once I see any new updates.

New RWS Support Portal
View in browser
 
 
The new Support Portal is LIVE!
 
You can now go to 
https://gateway.rws.com
 to get help with all of our technology products!
 
If you're using the old SDL URL, you'll be will be forwarded to the new site but you may want to update your bookmarks. As promised existing open cases have been migrated over so that work on those can continue without interruption.

subject: 📚 Celebrating a Decade of Creole Solutions and Learning!
body:
Celebrating 10 Years of Learning
with us!
Bonjou Maya!
 
As we continue celebrating Creole Solutions’ 10-year journey, this month’s spotlight is on 
Learning
, 
one of the most powerful ways we’ve seen Haitian Creole break barriers and open doors.
 
For too long, higher education and professional research in Haiti were associated almost exclusively with French, leaving Haitian Creole on the sidelines. But that’s changing, and Creole Solutions has played an active role in this shift.
In 2022, The United Nations launched its new website for Haiti in Haitian Creole.
What is possible? 
Learning!
Historically, higher learning in Haiti has been associated with French, as Haitian Creole was considered a spoken language. That perspective has undergone quite a few changes in the last decade, and 
Creole Solutions
 is proud to have played a role in this shift.
 
 
What learning is and how it is accessed have evolved
, with Haitian Creole gaining greater recognition. When the New York Times published an article on Haitian history in both English and Haitian Creole on May 23, 2022, it caused a sensation.
Later in the same year, the 
United Nations
 launched its brand-new website for Haiti 
in beautifully crafted Haitian Creole. Marleen and her team have always felt strongly that Haitian Creole can only be elevated by prioritizing proper grammar and spelling. 
These days, it is not uncommon for research institutes and museums to request translations from us. 
 
We were honored to collaborate with the Museum of Contemporary Art to include Haitian Creole translations in 
Didier William: Nou Kite Tout Sa Dèyè
.
 This powerful book, published alongside William’s largest solo museum exhibition, delves into race, immigration, and memory through his monumental paintings, printmaking, and sculpture.
 
The title, which translates to 
We’ve Left That All Behind
, reflects the Haitian immigrant experience—the journey of displacement, adaptation, and resilience. By incorporating Haitian Creole, we ensure that these narratives reach those who connect most deeply with them, reinforcing the idea that language should never be a barrier to understanding.
In Haitian culture, we say
 
Kreyòl pale, kreyòl konprann
—
when Creole is spoken, it is understood. When people have the opportunity to learn and engage in their own language, knowledge becomes more accessible, voices are amplified, and communities thrive.
 
Celebrate with Us!
 
From academic research to museum exhibitions, our language is breaking barriers and creating new opportunities. Every translation, publication, and collaboration brings us closer to a future where
 Creole is not just spoken but recognized, studied, and celebrated.
 
What’s Next?
Each month, we’ll share another story of what’s possible with Haitian Creole, celebrating the growth, creativity, and cultural pride that Creole Solutions has brought to life over the past decade.
 
Join us in championing Haitian Creole as a language of learning, knowledge, and innovation. Share your thoughts, stories, and experiences with us—because when 
Kreyòl pale, kreyòl konprann
, anything is possible!
Learn more about us
 
Stay in the loop!
For more updates and exciting news, make sure to follow our page and stay connected with us on social media. 
 
 
 
 
Creole Solutions, 4957 Oakton Street, Suite 203, Skokie, IL 60076, United States

Hello all, I'm new to Team and I'm trying to generate and download the analysis reports by language and file for a project using the API. I can't seem to see any endpoint for that, all tha...
Jean-François Pelletier on 17 Feb 2025 2:24 PM
Hello 
Daniel Brockmann
 ,
Thanks a lot, this is the answer to my question! :-)
I'm new to this API and how it works, and I didn't see the 
languageDirections.analysisStatistics
 option. I just tried it now and it's returning exactly what I was looking for... :-)
By the way, the API is well done and well documented, it's just a bit overwhelming to find my way around after just a few days...
Kind regards,

Daniel Brockmann on 17 Feb 2025 9:04 AM
Hi,
We had this question a number of times, and here's the answer we gave in this context before:
“The public API can be used to access analysis statistics using the Get Project endpoint, section analysisStatistics 
https://languagecloud.sdl.com/lc/api-docs/fd9ee0beb37ca-get-project
 . The model/information exposed under Get Project is described at 
https://languagecloud.sdl.com/lc/api-docs/4d1cce730f2af-analysis-statistics
. Locked segments information is not yet exposed, we have a feature request for this down the road.
In addition to this, when executing the call, you could request via query parameter 
fields=analysisStatistics,languageDirections.analysisStatistics
, either if you want the whole project statistics, or language direction level statistics. On the response then with minimal parsing/navigating logic, the data should be available.”
Would the second paragraph help with your second question in terms of language level?
Thanks, Daniel

 by

 on 12 Feb 2025 1:16 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hi, Trados Community! It would be of great help if the measurement checks (Verification > QA checker 3.0 > Numbers > Check measurements and currencies) was refined. Errors in units of me...
Jesús Prieto on 18 Feb 2025 8:47 AM
Barbara Brawn
 
I’ve voted up, but while improvements are implemented, you may want to go ahead and add customised regex rules.
For example you can add the rule to check that if 
cm
 is in Source and not in target, it must be reported. The regex would be 
\bcm\b
.
Or you can combine as many symbols as you wish 
\b(mm|cm|ml|L|l|g|mmHg)\b
 or even full words (for example, if 
hour
 is in Source, there must be 
hora
 in the Spanish target; similar for seconds, minutes, days, weeks, months, years). 
You can add rules for checking numbers too.
About the issue with 
L
 and 
l
 symbols, I’m not sure about that, but I think that the measurement 
L
 expects 
L
 in target, while 
l
 symbol expects 
l
. Again you can add a regex rule that if \
b[Ll]\b
 is matched in Source, 
\bl\b
 must be matched in Target (case sensitive).
I have it in that way, literally hundred of regex rules per target language, and some checks in Verifier turned off. It’s true that I get some unavoidable false positives, but really very few. A couple of manageable false positives is a minor collateral damage while assuring that days are not translated as years, for example.
I hope it helps. More information in the following link: 
https://lalinternadeltraductor.org/n19/rule-based-qa.html

File project on Trados Team
by 
Mario Kapinova
 on 13 Feb 2025 7:46 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Hello!
I work at the university where I started working with The Trados Team. 
Can you help me understand if many students can translate the same file into a project without each other's results being completed? 
RWS Community AI on 13 Feb 2025 7:46 PM
"Probability score": 0.8
"Question improvement suggestion": Please provide more details about the version of Trados Team you are using and the operating system. Also, it would be helpful to know if you have tried any troubleshooting steps.
In the meantime, based on the information you have provided, here is a suggested answer to your question:
Hello,
Yes, multiple students can work on the same file in a Trados Team project without overwriting each other's work. This is possible through the use of the "Check Out" and "Check In" features in Trados Team. Here's how it works:
Step 1: A student (Translator A) checks out the file they want to work on. This locks the file, preventing others from editing it.
Step 2: Translator A works on the file and then checks it back in when they're done. This updates the file in the project and unlocks it.
Step 3: Another student (Translator B) can now check out the file and see the changes made by Translator A. They can then make their own edits without overwriting Translator A's work.
Step 4: Translator B checks the file back in when they're done, updating the project file with their changes.
This process can be repeated with as many translators as needed. Each translator's work is preserved and visible to others when they check out the file.
Remember to always check in the file after you're done working on it to ensure your changes are saved and visible to others.
I hope this answer addressed your question. If not, please reject the answer, add the question improvement suggestion information, and click the RWS Community AI checkbox on the right to try again.
RWS Community AI

Highlighting Read-Only access in Trados Enterprise TM Maintenance
by 
Bernhard Hoell
 on 12 Feb 2025 1:45 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
Why doesn´t Trados Enterprise show read-only access in a more intutitive way?
Currently when someone has access to a TM that is visible to them but not available with editing permissions (PJM permissions), it is possible to go into the TM maintenance mode.
The maintenance mode will not show clearly that you do not have editing permissions, even more confusing is that you get little popups that showcase the capabities of the maintenance window, however ignore that you may not have all the permissions required:
The only visual hint that you cannot edit here is that you cannot write in segments and the confirm changes button (among others) is greyed out.
Some other visual marker should indicate that you are not allowed to change the content.
This is confusing to project managers.
Is this something that is on the roadmap for getting enhanced?
RWS Community AI on 12 Feb 2025 1:45 PM
"Probability score": 0.6
"Question improvement suggestion": Please provide the version of Trados Enterprise you are using and any error messages you may have encountered. Also, it would be helpful if you could describe any troubleshooting steps you have already taken.
In the meantime, based on the information you have provided, here is a suggested answer to your question:
Hello,
I understand your concern about the lack of clear visual indicators for read-only access in Trados Enterprise TM Maintenance. This can indeed be confusing for project managers who are trying to manage and maintain their translation memories.
As of now, the only visual indicators for read-only access are the inability to write in segments and the greyed out 'Confirm Changes' button. I agree that more intuitive visual markers would be beneficial.
However, I'm unable to confirm whether enhancements to this feature are on the roadmap. The development team at Trados is always working to improve the user experience, and feedback like yours is invaluable in guiding these improvements. I recommend keeping your software up to date to benefit from the latest features and improvements.
In the meantime, you can use the current visual indicators (inability to write in segments and the greyed out 'Confirm Changes' button) to identify when you have read-only access.
I hope this answer addressed your question. If not, please reject the answer, add the question improvement suggestion information, and click the RWS Community AI checkbox on the right to try again.
RWS Community AI

My LSP normally work bidirectionally so managing multiple parallel projects, syncing information, compiling data, etc. is a drain on staff time.

How to give permission to a freelancer
by 
Xavier Coutant
 on 10 Feb 2025 1:56 PM in 
2. Trados Enterprise, Accelerate, Team & cloud capabilities in Studio
I use Trados Team.
I would like to assign a translation to a freelance translator who uses Trados Studio.
I created the translator in Trados Team. I sent her an invitation, that she accepted. However, she can not open the Trados file due to the following error message : "You do not have sufficient permissions to access this account".
What am I doing wrong ? I suppose I have to give the translator permission to access the file but I don't know how to do it. Anyobe who can help me?
Xavier Coutant on 10 Feb 2025 2:04 PM
I don't want the freelance translator to use my account. I want the freelancer to use her own Traos Studio account. Trados Team would only be used to send her the file she has to translate. The xliff file I would send her, would show her what has already been translated on the basis of our translation memory.
RWS Community AI on 10 Feb 2025 1:57 PM
"Probability score": 0.9
"Question improvement suggestion": Please provide the exact version of Trados Team and Trados Studio you and your freelancer are using. Also, it would be helpful to know if there have been any recent changes to your system or software.
In the meantime, based on the information you have provided, here is a suggested answer to your question:
Hello,
It seems like you've done most of the steps correctly. However, the error message your freelancer is receiving indicates that she might not have the necessary permissions to access the project. Here's how you can grant her the necessary permissions:
Step 1: Log in to your Trados Team account.
Step 2: Navigate to the 'Users' section.
Step 3: Find the freelancer's account and click on it.
Step 4: In the 'Permissions' section, ensure that the freelancer has the 'Project Manager' role. This role allows the user to access and manage all projects.
Step 5: Save the changes.
After these steps, your freelancer should be able to access the project without any issues. If the problem persists, it might be due to the number of concurrent users exceeding the number of available licenses. In this case, you might need to purchase additional licenses.
I hope this answer addressed your question. If not, please reject the answer, add the question improvement suggestion information, and click the RWS Community AI checkbox on the right to try again.
RWS Community AI

Use Trados Studio to mark sources against reference materials
by 
Diana Palenzuela
 on 12 Feb 2025 1:25 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hi, Community!
We are looking for a way to mark files (currently these are Word files that are highlighted) to identify text coming from various reference materials. Studio already identifies terms or phrases coming from termbases, and so we would like to use this to mark the source files up, export the file onto .docx and use it for offline projects. This process currently takes up to 3 hours per 70-page file, as one of the reference materials contains 30k+ terms, so we believe we can greatly improve efficiency with a Studio-based process.
Before you suggest it: no, our client is not prepared to use Studio for the translations themselves. There are a few operational difficulties as we deal with updates (so, tracked changes) and have had CAPAs in the past. We are only looking at adapting our offline process for now.
Thank you!
 
Refine the measurement checks
by 
Diana Palenzuela
 on 12 Feb 2025 1:16 PM in 
Trados Studio Ideas
Hi, Trados Community!
It would be of great help if the measurement checks (Verification > QA checker 3.0 > Numbers > Check measurements and currencies) was refined. Errors in units of measurements result in major/critical feedback from RI clients, with good reason - patients getting the wrong dose of the medicine, for instance.
The current in-built checker only checks measurements when they appear together with a digit, but that's not how all units of measurement appear in files: you can get, for example, a request to 'report the length of your rash in cm' or tables in which the table header includes the units of measurement so that each cell doesn't include it (this is standard practice in STEM), as well as axes, graphs, and a myriad other scenarios.
Furthermore, the current feature will warn that "measurement is missing in target segment or is not properly localised" where the source contains a number and a UoM but the target only contains a UoM: source: 5 cm/target: cm. In this case, this is a false positive as there is no problem with the units of measurement, only with the numbers. If both the numbers and units of measurement are activated in the Verify, then you get duplicated warnings. The number and unit of measurement checks should be independent, only getting a warning for numbers if there's a number mismatch; and only getting a warning for measurements if there's a UoM mismatch.
It also seems that the measurements aren't properly localised - is there a way to customise this? I have an en-es-ES file and it's showing a warning where the source is 5 g/L while the target is 5 g/l - in Spanish for Spain, the symbol for 'litres' is an upper case 'l,' so this is correct.
Diana Palenzuela on 14 Feb 2025 8:38 AM
Sorry, small correction here as I don't seem to be able to edit: 
It also seems that the measurements aren't properly localised - is there a way to customise this? I have an en-es-ES file and it's showing a warning where the source is 5 g/L (en-GB) while the target is 5 g/l (es-ES) - in Spanish for Spain, the symbol for 'litres' is a lower case 'l' and in English (UK) it's an upper case L, so this is correct.

body:
Dear Project Manager,
 
I trust this message finds you well. As a professional translator, I have had the pleasure of working with valued clients like Language & Culture Worldwide and I am grateful for your past support.
 
I have enjoyed assisting with your translation, MTPE, editing and review needs over the last years, ensuring accurate communication across languages. I appreciate the trust you have placed in my services.
 
I am reaching out to remind you that my Italian translation services are still available whenever you need. Whether it's technical content, software localization, legal documents, marketing content or any other linguistic assistance, I am here to help. 
 
In addition to this, I would like to inform you that I also provide my language services from French, Spanish, and German to Italian. This is to ensure that I can cater to a wider range of your linguistic needs.
 
As a token of my gratitude, I am offering a 5% discount on your next translation project. This offer is exclusive to returning customers like you.
 
I am open to discussing your specific needs and tailoring my services accordingly. 
 
If you have any upcoming projects or need assistance, please feel free to reach out. I look forward to potentially working with you again and providing high-quality translations.
 
For any questions or further information, please contact me at 
mesposito@alphatrad.net
 / +39-335-1777-446.
 
Wishing you continued success!
 
Warm regards,
-------------------------------- 
Dr. Michele Esposito
Senior Translator
Alphatrad Worldwide Ltd
Specializations:
 IT, IP, Automotive, Marketing, Law, Finance, Life Sciences

DIN EN ISO 17100:2016-05 Certified

subject: New RWS Support Portal
body:
New RWS Support Portal
View in browser
 
 
New RWS Support Portal
 
Dear Customer,
 
Further to our announcement of the upcoming new Support Portal, we are pleased to confirm that, pending successful internal testing, the new portal will be launched next month. We will be in touch with a confirmed date closer to the launch.  Rest assured, any cases that are open at that time will be seamlessly migrated to the new system.
 
While the new portal should feel very familiar, we will provide additional documentation to help you settle in. This documentation will be available closer to the launch date.
 
Thank you for your continued support!
 
The RWS Support Team
